page.title: 08 Miss Robinson
page.content: Miss. Dora Robinson has lived in Barnwell all her life and was born in the village shop on 26th January 1899. She was the 102nd girl to go to Barnwell C.E. Primary School on 1st October 1906. Dora still enjoys coming to school and joining in with the crowning of the May Queen, as she did last year (1984). Every Sunday Miss. Robinson opens the church doors to all the people that go to church. She helps with arranging the church flowers and cleaning the brass gates, candlesticks and cross. She is also a member of the W.I. and the Friendly Club. Recently she went to Buckingham Palace to meet the Queen and she also talked to T.R.H. Prince & Princess of Wales.
